page.title: 04 The Village School
page.content: There has been a school in Woodford Halse since the 1840's.Only children from the village went there.In 1895, when the railway opened,the population grew and by 1914 there were two schools.After the 2nd.world war they became a Primary (5 years to 11 years) and a Secondary (11 to 15).In 1970 the Secondary School was closed and the 11+ children now go to Southbrook Comprehensive School in Daventry.The Primary School moved into its building. Children now come to the school from other villages where the school has been closed,such as Eydon,Preston Capes,Little Preston,Canons Ashby and West Farndon.There are 137 children,86 Juniors and 51 Infants.There are 6 teachers;Mr.Weaver(Headmaster),Mrs. Gottowik(Deputy Head),Mr.Smith,Miss Berry,Miss Hewison and Mrs.Conlon.
